cyclone.name: FRANKLIN
cyclone.current_location: about 260 miles (420 km) south of Santo Domingo, Dominican Republic
cyclone.trajectory: Expected to turn north today, cross Hispaniola Wednesday, then move north-northeast into the western Atlantic east of the Bahamas

weather_observation.watch_coast: Dominican Republic entire north and east coast; Turks and Caicos Islands
weather_observation.warning_coast: Dominican Republic entire south coast; Haiti south coast from Anse d'Hainault to the Dominican Republic border
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Haiti, Dominican Republic, Turks & Caicos, and later portions of the Bahamas
weather_observation.wind: Breezy conditions with only a slight (≤4%) chance of sustained tropical-storm-force (≥34 kt) winds; most winds expected below gale force
weather_observation.rainfall: 1–3 inches widespread with isolated totals to 6 inches; localized urban and small-stream flooding possible
weather_observation.other_hazards: Isolated flash flooding or mudslides in steep terrain could disrupt port access roads
